results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Mass Shootings;Firearms;Nova Scotia, Canada, Shooting (April, 2020);Canada
results.byline: By Ian Austen and Vjosa Isai
results.title: Canada Plans to Ban Handgun Sales and Possession of Assault Weapons
results.abstract: “We have a responsibility to act to prevent more tragedies,” Prime Minister Trudeau said as he proposed tightening the country’s already stringent control of firearms.

media.caption: Seized firearms in 2021 are displayed during a Royal Canadian Mounted Police and Crime Stoppers news conference in Surrey, British Columbia.
media.copyright: Darryl Dyck/The Canadian Press, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Military Aircraft;Civilian Casualties;Bombs and Explosives;Pilots;Chernihiv (Ukraine)
results.byline: By Valerie Hopkins and Maria Varenikova
results.title: A Russian Plane Crashed Into a House. Death Was Parceled Out Randomly.
results.abstract: Some fortuitous timing in doing chores saved a family that lived in the Ukrainian city of Chernihiv. A few blocks away, things turned out very differently.

media.caption: Yulia Hrebnyeva amid the wreckage of a Russian warplane that crashed into her family’s home in Chernihiv, Ukraine, in March. “The bricks were just pouring down,” she said. “Everything started to shake.”
media.copyright: David Guttenfelder for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Airlines and Airplanes;Deaths (Fatalities);Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Nepal
results.byline: By Bhadra Sharma and Karan Deep Singh
results.title: All 22 Bodies Are Recovered in Nepal Plane Crash
results.abstract: The plane went down in bad weather on Sunday while carrying passengers to Jomsom, a tourist destination popular with trekkers.

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;Rumors and Misinformation;Presidential Election of 2020;Voter Fraud (Election Fraud);Voting and Voters;Fringe Groups and Movements;Conspiracy Theories;Project Democracy;Trump, Donald J;Mitchell, Cleta
results.title: Lawyer Who Plotted to Overturn Trump Loss Recruits Election Deniers to Watch Over the Vote
results.abstract: A central figure in the scheme to reverse the 2020 election is mobilizing grass-roots activists into an “army of citizens” trained to aggressively monitor elections.

media.caption: Cleta Mitchell, a Republican lawyer and architect of Donald J. Trump’s failed efforts to overturn the 2020 presidential election, at the Pennsylvania Leadership Conference in April.

results.adx_keywords: Photography;News and News Media;School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Mass Shootings;Civil Rights Movement (1954-68);George Floyd Protests (2020);Newtown, Conn, Shooting (2012);New York Times
results.title: From Sandy Hook to Uvalde, the Violent Images Never Seen
results.abstract: Frustrated Americans ask whether the release of graphic photos of gun violence would lead to better policy. But which photos, and who decides?

media.caption: Sister Clarice Suchy, right, consoled Orelia Barker the day after the massacre at Robb Elementary School in Uvalde, Texas. The crime scene was closed to news photographers.
media.copyright: Ivan Pierre Aguirre for The New York Times

results.byline: By Andrew E. Kramer and Jason Horowitz
results.title: Ukraine Battle Expands as Kyiv Launches Counteroffensive
results.abstract: “Hold on, Kherson, we’re coming!” the Ukrainian military declared as it pushed to retake territory in a key southern city.

media.caption: A Ukrainian soldier in a trench on the front lines in the Donetsk region on Sunday.
media.copyright: Finbarr O'Reilly for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: A Son Was Lost, a Daughter Saved
results.abstract: In Uvalde, Texas, where many children were killed, one family grieves the death of a small boy and holds his sister close.

media.caption: Jose Manuel Flores Sr. rearranging a makeshift memorial to his son at his home in Uvalde, Texas.
media.copyright: Ivan Pierre Aguirre for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Demonstrations, Protests and Riots;UEFA Champions League (Soccer);Politics and Government;Fans (Persons);Soccer;Stadiums and Arenas;Real Madrid (Soccer Team);Liverpool (Soccer Team);Paris (France)
results.byline: By Aurelien Breeden and Tariq Panja
results.title: Under Fire for Chaos at Soccer Final, France Rejects Blame for Failures
results.abstract: Tear gas and delays marred the Champions League final in Paris on Saturday, raising questions over France’s ability to host large-scale sporting events like the 2024 Summer Olympics.

media.caption: Liverpool fans are locked outside the Stade de France stadium prior to the UEFA Champions League final on Saturday in Paris.

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Grandparents;Elderly;Haridwar (India);India
results.byline: By Sameer Yasir and Mike Ives
results.title: No Grandchild? Six Years After Son’s Wedding, These Parents Are Suing
results.abstract: A couple in India are demanding that their son and daughter-in-law have a child or pay them $650,000 in damages. “This is an Indian parent thing,” their lawyer said.

media.caption: Sanjeev Ranjan Prasad, left, and Sadhana Prasad at a lawyer’s office in Haridwar, India, in May.

results.adx_keywords: Meteors and Meteorites;Comets;Space and Astronomy;Content Type: Service;Research;History (Academic Subject)
results.title: You May See a New Meteor Shower in Night Skies, or Nothing at All
results.abstract: A comet’s breakup three decades ago could produce a seldom-seen meteor storm on Monday night. Or it could be a complete dud.

media.caption: A Perseid meteor shower shined last year in Spruce Knob, W.Va. Most meteor showers occur when Earth runs into debris from a comet.
media.copyright: Bill Ingalls/NASA, via Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Hurricanes and Tropical Storms;Mexico
results.title: Agatha Moves Across Southern Mexico as a Tropical Storm
results.abstract: The storm, which made landfall as Category 2 hurricane, was expected to move inland over the state of Oaxaca on Tuesday before dissipating.

media.caption: Seeking protection from the rain as Hurricane Agatha approaches southern Mexico, in Tuxtla Chico, in Chiapas State.

results.byline: By Lauren McCarthy and Christine Chung
results.title: Holiday weekend in the U.S. resembles prepandemic times, as experts and the White House remain wary of virus risk.

media.caption: And so it began, the Memorial Day weekend on I-495 in McLean, Va., near Washington, D.C., on Friday afternoon.

results.title: Calling In Sick Is More Fraught Than Ever
results.abstract: A new normal around staying home while sick is impossible in America.

results.title: F.B.I. Investigates Basquiat Paintings Shown at Orlando Museum of Art
results.abstract: A subpoena raises questions about an exhibition of works “purported to be by artist Jean-Michel Basquiat.”

media.caption: At the Orlando Museum of Art, installers hung “Untitled (Boxer),” a work said to be by Jean-Michel Basquiat, in “Heroes & Monsters,” a show currently at the museum. It is one of 25 works under investigation by the F.B.I.’s Art Crime Team.
media.copyright: Melanie Metz for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Smallpox;Vaccination and Immunization;Monkeypox;Antibodies;Immune System;Europe;United States
results.title: Who Is Protected Against Monkeypox?
results.abstract: Older people who received smallpox vaccinations may yet have some immunity, researchers say. Healthy children and adults generally do not become severely ill.

media.caption: A laboratory of the biotech company Bavarian Nordic, which produces a smallpox vaccine that is also effective against monkeypox.
